Subjective: Red, irritated right eye since Tuesday morning; feels like foreign body; worse on right > left; no pain, no vision changes, no discharge; no fever, no cough, no shortness of breath; no prior eye issues; no smoking or alcohol; works full-time, caring for toddler, boyfriend away; Request: Wants diagnosis, treatment options, safety netting.
Objective: Vitals: Not provided; PE: Right eye red, thickened conjunctiva; left eye mild redness; no foreign body, no discharge; pupils reactive, normal extraocular movements; no other abnormalities.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis; no bacterial signs, no corneal abrasion, no other eye pathology.
Plan: Artificial tears as needed for comfort
Safety net: Return if no improvement in 2 weeks, or if pain, vision changes, or increased discharge develops
